                              UT MEDICAL CENTER

Patient Name: JEWEL D BALL
Birth Date: 12/23/1945

Referring Doctor: WEST, JESSICA WENGAR
Reading Doctor: KVAMME, PETER 
Visit No.: 23059860002
Order No.: 5998368111
Exam Date: 03/10/2023 11:15:10
Exam: 22514 - AN Kyphoplasty, Perc, Lumbar 22514
================================================================================

DOB: 12/23/1945
History Number:2305986
History: L1 vertebral body now vertebra plana. Acute compression fracture of L4.

Procedure:  Full Medicare maximum sterile barrier technique maintained throughout procedure. Prophylactic antibiotics included Ancef 2 g IV. General anesthesia provided by the anesthesia department.  Then, patient was transferred to fluoroscopy table in the prone position.  

Then under fluoroscopic needle guidance we advanced 11-gauge needles through the right pedicle into L4 vertebral body.  Then we advanced the midline osteotome through pedicle access needle to create cavities for vertebral augmentation.  Then we proceeded with vertebral augmentation, advancing the Stryker curved delivery needles through pedicle needle into the inferior aspect vertebral body. Then we administered methyl methacrylate through each of the curve delivery needle under continuous fluoroscopic visualization.   We delivered a total of 9 cc cement which distributed throughout L4 vertebral body. Then, conventional manual compression was applied.  

No immediate complications.  Patient tolerated the procedure well.

Fluoroscopy time 9.0 minutes, following radiation goals as low as reasonably possible to perform safe procedure, necessary to carefully complete diagnostic and interventional procedure successfully. ALARA Utilization:  Dose reduction technique was used including one or more of the following: automated exposure control, iterative reconstruction technique, adjustment of mA and kV according to patient size and/or scan done according to ALARA (exposure dose as low as reasonably achievable)
Total number of fluoroscopic images 133 images
Total DAP: 2063.5 uGym*2

Impression:
1.  L1 vertebra plana- not amenable to kyphoplasty
2.  Acute compression fracture L4, biopsy and vertebral augmentation (i.e. kyphoplasty) of L4 vertebral body

PLAT-BIPLANE

L1 KYPHOPLASTY
)

BILATERAL FOOT SERIES
 
HISTORY: Bilateral foot pain.
 
COMPARISON: None.
 
FINDINGS:  A three view exam of each foot demonstrates no acute fracture
or dislocation of either foot. The joint spaces appear unremarkable. No
soft tissue abnormality is seen. There is normal mineralization. There
are no erosions.    
 
IMPRESSION: No acute osseous abnormality of either foot.
 
 
   
 
BILATERAL HAND SERIES
 
HISTORY: Bilateral hand pain, arthritis.
 
COMPARISON: None.
 
FINDINGS:  A three view exam of each hand demonstrates no acute fracture
or dislocation of either hand. The joint spaces reveal mild DIP and PIP
joint space narrowing bilaterally. There are mild hypertrophic changes
of the right third metacarpal phalangeal joint. There are mild
hypertrophic changes of the basilar joints bilaterally. No soft tissue
abnormality is seen. There is normal mineralization. There are no
erosions.    
 
IMPRESSION: Degenerative findings bilaterally with no acute osseous
abnormality of either hand.
